Sentencas: Mathematical modeling of methane-fed anode-supported micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cell (MT-SOFC) is developed.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Steam reforming of methane is considered in two cases of: direct internal reforming (DIR) and gradual internal reforming (GIR).
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The polarization curves and temperature distribution of a cell fed with three variations of fueling (i.e., DIR and GIR of methane and pure hydrogen) are compared with each other.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The simulation results are verified through temperature and performance measurements of a MT-SOFC sample operating on above three variations of fueling.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In DIR operating condition, a drop in the anode gas temperature at a short distance after entering the cell takes place which results in high temperature gradient.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In GIR operating condition, the temperature distribution in axial direction is steadier.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The ohmic loss is lower in the case of pure hydrogen fuel than internal reforming of methane, but the concentration loss is lower in methane-fed operating conditions.
Titulo: Study of thermal effects on the performance of micro-tubular solid-oxide fuel cells
